# PhysicsMotionComponent

**Structure**

A component that controls the motion of the body in physics simulations.

## Declaration

```swift
struct PhysicsMotionComponent
```

## Overview

You specify velocities in the coordinate space of the physics simulation defined by [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicsSimulationComponent/nearestSimulationEntity(for:)].

The behavior of an entity with a physics motion component depends on the entity’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicsBodyComponent/mode] setting:



## Creating the motion component

- **init()**: Creates a physics motion component at rest.
- **init(linearVelocity:angularVelocity:)**: Creates a physics motion component with the given velocities.

## Setting velocity

- **angularVelocity**: The angular velocity of the body around the center of mass.
- **linearVelocity**: The linear velocity of the body in the physics simulation.

## Physics motion

- **ImpulseAction**: An action that applies an impulse to the physics body at its center of mass when played as an animation.

## Conforms To

- Component
- Equatable
